text: John Robert "Chick" Webster (November 3, 1920 - January 18, 2018) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He was born in Toronto, Ontario. He played 14 games in the National Hockey League. He played with the New York Rangers during the 1949-50 season. After Milt Schmidt's death in January 2017, he became the oldest living former NHL player.Milt Schmidt was a gentleman off the ice, relentless on it Webster died on January 18, 2018 in Mattawa, Ontario at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1920 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey centres Category:Eastern Hockey League players Category:New York Rangers players Category:Ice hockey people from Toronto
title: Chick Webster
